authentication.title: Authentication
authentication.description: If authentication is enabled, you can control access to the site and to individual modules. Authentication is handled through one or more authentication authorities. Controlling access to the site and modules is handled in the Authorization section shown above when authentication is enabled.

authorities.title: Authentication Authorities
authorities.description: Authentication authorities are backend systems used to authenticate users. Kurogo includes variety of classes to authenticate users to a variety of standards based systems as well as popular external services.

CONTROLLER_CLASS.label: Authentication Type
CONTROLLER_CLASS.description: The type of back end system.

USER_LOGIN.label: Login type
USER_LOGIN.description: Type of login form. Direct logins (Basic, Database, LDAP, AD) show a login form. Indirect logins (Google, Facebook, Twitter) send the user to an external login screen provided by the service. Choose None if you only want to provide group services.

PASSWD_DESCRIPTION.label: Description
PASSWD_DESCRIPTION.value: The basic authority allows you to authenticate users using a custom unix passwd style file located on the server.

PASSWD_USER_FILE.label: User file
PASSWD_USER_FILE.description: Location of the passwd style file that contains user data. Consult the documentation for the format of this file

PASSWD_GROUP_FILE.label: Group file
PASSWD_GROUP_FILE.description: Location of the file that contains group data. Consult the documentation for the format of this file

DB_DESCRIPTION.label: Description
DB_DESCRIPTION.value: The database authority allows you to authenticate users against a database.

DB_TYPE.label: Database type
DB_TYPE.description: The type of database system to connect to. If Default then it will use the same values specified in the Site "Database Configuration" section

DB_HOST.label: Database host
DB_HOST.description: The fully qualified hostname of the database server

DB_USER.label: Database user
DB_USER.description: The username used to connect to the database server

DB_PASS.label: Database password
DB_PASS.description: The password used to connect to the database server

DB_DBNAME.label: Database
DB_DBNAME.description: The database used to store the user data on the database server

DB_FILE.label: Database file
DB_FILE.description: The location of the SQLite database file.

DB_USER_TABLE.label: User table
DB_USER_TABLE.description: The table used to store user records. This is optional if you only use this authority for group records

DB_GROUP_TABLE.label: Group table
DB_GROUP_TABLE.description: The table used to store group records. This is optional if you only use this authority for user records

DB_GROUPMEMBERS_TABLE.label: Group members table
DB_GROUPMEMBERS_TABLE.description: The table used to store members of each group. This is optional if you only use this authority for user records

DB_USER_USERID_FIELD.label: UserID field
DB_USER_USERID_FIELD.description: Field used in the user table that contains usernames

DB_USER_PASSWORD_FIELD.label: User password field
DB_USER_PASSWORD_FIELD.description: Field used in the user table that contains passwords. Passwords should be hashed using the password hash type value.

DB_USER_PASSWORD_HASH.label: Password hash type
DB_USER_PASSWORD_HASH.description: Method used to hash user passwords.

DB_USER_PASSWORD_SALT.label: Password hash salt
DB_USER_PASSWORD_SALT.description: String value that is prepended to each password before hashing

DB_USER_EMAIL_FIELD.label: User email field
DB_USER_EMAIL_FIELD.description: Field used in the user table that contains email addresses

DB_USER_FIRSTNAME_FIELD.label: User first name field
DB_USER_FIRSTNAME_FIELD.description: Field used in the user table that contains user's first name

DB_USER_LASTNAME_FIELD.label: User last name field
DB_USER_LASTNAME_FIELD.description: Field used in the user table that contains user's last name

DB_USER_FULLNAME_FIELD.label: User full name field
DB_USER_FULLNAME_FIELD.description: Field used in the user table that contains user's full name

DB_GROUP_GROUPNAME_FIELD.label: Group group name field
DB_GROUP_GROUPNAME_FIELD.description: Field used in the group table that contains the group short name

DB_GROUP_GID_FIELD.label: Group ID field
DB_GROUP_GID_FIELD.description: Field used in the group table that contains the group id

DB_GROUPMEMBER_GROUP_FIELD.label: Group member group field
DB_GROUPMEMBER_GROUP_FIELD.description: Field used in the group member table that contains group short name

DB_GROUPMEMBER_USER_FIELD.label: Group member user field
DB_GROUPMEMBER_USER_FIELD.description: Field used in the group member table that contains the user id

DB_GROUPMEMBER_AUTHORITY_FIELD.label: Group member authority field
DB_GROUPMEMBER_AUTHORITY_FIELD.description: Field used in the group member table that contains the user's authority. If you store the authority id in your group table, you can reference users from other authorities.

DB_GROUP_GROUPMEMBER_PROPERTY.label: Group member group field
DB_GROUP_GROUPMEMBER_PROPERTY.description: Which group field is used in the group members table.

AD_DESCRIPTION.label: Description
AD_DESCRIPTION.value: The Active Directory authority allows you to authenticate users against a Microsoft Active Directory Domain.

LDAP_DESCRIPTION.label: Description
LDAP_DESCRIPTION.value: The LDAP authority allows you to authenticate users against a standard LDAP server.

LDAP_HOST.label: Server
LDAP_HOST.description: The fully qualified hostname for the server.

LDAP_SEARCH_BASE.label: Search Base
LDAP_SEARCH_BASE.description: LDAP Search base used for queries. Contact your LDAP administrator for this value

LDAP_USER_SEARCH_BASE.label: User Search Base
LDAP_USER_SEARCH_BASE.description: Optional search base to use for user records. Useful if you wish to restrict users to a certain container/OU.

LDAP_USER_UID_FIELD.label: userID Field
LDAP_USER_UID_FIELD.description: LDAP field to use for usernames/short names.

LDAP_USER_EMAIL_FIELD.label: email Field
LDAP_USER_EMAIL_FIELD.description: LDAP field to user for email data

LDAP_USER_FIRSTNAME_FIELD.label: First name field
LDAP_USER_FIRSTNAME_FIELD.description: LDAP field to use for for first name

LDAP_USER_LASTNAME_FIELD.label: Last name field
LDAP_USER_LASTNAME_FIELD.description: LDAP field to use for for last name

LDAP_GROUP_SEARCH_BASE.label: Group search base
LDAP_GROUP_SEARCH_BASE.description: Optional search base to use for group records. Useful if you wish to restrict groups to a certain container/OU

LDAP_GROUP_GID_FIELD.label: Group id field
LDAP_GROUP_GID_FIELD.description: LDAP field to use for the group id

LDAP_GROUP_MEMBERS_FIELD.label: Group members field
LDAP_GROUP_MEMBERS_FIELD.description: Optional LDAP field used in group records that contain the list of users who are members of that group

LDAP_ADMIN_DN.label: Admin DN
LDAP_ADMIN_DN.description: If you LDAP server does not permit anonymous queries (which is the case for most Active Directory domains), enter a distinguished name of an account that has read access to the containers you will need to authenticate. For best security limit this account to read only and include only the containers needed.

LDAP_ADMIN_PASSWORD.label: Admin Password
LDAP_ADMIN_PASSWORD.description: (Optional) The password for the service account entered above.

FACEBOOK_DESCRIPTION.label: Description
FACEBOOK_DESCRIPTION.value: The FaceBook authority allows you to authenticate users using the FaceBook service. The login type must be set to Indirect. Please read the developer documentation about setup instructions for this authority

FACEBOOK_API_KEY.label: API Key
FACEBOOK_API_KEY.description: API Key as provided by FaceBook.

FACEBOOK_API_SECRET.label: API Secret
FACEBOOK_API_SECRET.description: API Secret as provided by FaceBook.

GOOGLE_DESCRIPTION.label: Description
GOOGLE_DESCRIPTION.value: The Google authority allows you to authenticate users using the Google service. The login type must be set to Indirect. Please read the developer documentation about setup instructions for this authority

GOOGLEAPPS_DESCRIPTION.label: Description
GOOGLEAPPS_DESCRIPTION.value: The Google Apps authority allows you to authenticate users your Google Apps domain. The login type must be set to Indirect. Please read the developer documentation about setup instructions for this authority

TWITTER_DESCRIPTION.label: Description
TWITTER_DESCRIPTION.value: The Twitter authority allows you to authenticate users using the Twitter service. The login type must be set to Indirect. Please read the developer documentation about setup instructions for this authority

OPENID_REALM.label: OpenID Realm
OPENID_REALM.description: The OpenID realm to use. This must be the same as the domain name for your site. If you are using OAuth it must match your consumer key. If left blank, then the realm will be determined by the server hostname. Should be in format http://example.com

GOOGLE_REQUIRE_LOGIN.label: Require authentication
GOOGLE_REQUIRE_LOGIN.description: This setting affects whether users must reauthenticate to Google when logging in, even if they have logged into Google from their browser. If blank then users will not have to reauthenticate. If 0 then users will always have to authenticate. If greater than 0 then users will have to re-authenticate after the indicated number of seconds since their last authentication.

GOOGLE_OAUTH_DESCRIPTION.label: OAuth
GOOGLE_OAUTH_DESCRIPTION.value: If your site will be utilizing Google Data (like calendars) then you will need to setup OAuth. If you are only authenticating users, then it is not necessary

GOOGLE_SCOPE.label: Scope
GOOGLE_SCOPE.description: A series of urls that represent the Google Data sources you wish to access. Each url should be on a single line. See http://code.google.com/apis/gdata/faq.html#AuthScopes for a list of valid scope urls.

authorities.sectionsnone: There are no authorities defined for this site
authorities.sectionaddprompt: Enter a short id for this authority. It should contain only alphanumeric characters and no spaces.

authorization.title: Access Control
authorization.description: Once a userâ€™s identity has been established, it is possible to authorize use of the site based on their identity. Authorization is accomplished through access control lists. This section manages access control lists for the entire site. If you want to protect only individual modules, use the Authorization section of that module. If there are no ACL entries then the site is open to anyone without logging in.

type.label: Type
type.description: Access: restrict access to the site. Admin restrict administrative access to the site

action.label: Action
action.description: Allow grant access to the site. Deny deny access to the site. Any user who matches a deny rule will be denied access.

scope.label: Scope
scope.description: User matches a user with the user name specified in Value below. Group matches a group with the group name specified in Value below. Everyone matches all users, including not logged in users.

authority.label: Authority
authority.description: Specify the authority to use for the user/group value. You can either select a specific authority or Any which will match a user/group from any authority.

value.label: Value
value.description: The specific user/group to match. To match all users enter *

authorization.sectionsnone: There are no ACLs defined for this site.
